nodes.bodyText: same comment as previous PR, using a more readable format could make future debugs easier. e.g. use "-" or similar

why is sortBy and sortDirection getting combined?
they would need to get separated before they can be applied, so why combine them in the first place?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -97,14 +96,7 @@
 
     AppParticipantsResponse appParticipantsResponse =
         appService.getAppParticipants(
-            appId,
-            userId,
-            auditRequest,
-            excludeParticipantStudyStatus,
-            limit,
-            offset,
-            sortBy + "_" + sortDirection,
-            searchTerm);
+            appId, userId, auditRequest, limit, offset, sortBy + "_" + sortDirection, searchTerm);

nodes.bodyText:
We tried to append the ASC or DESC to the query at the end but it didn't work. ASC or DESC should appear after the END  so we combined sortBy and sortDirection as orderByCondition.
WHEN 'email_asc' THEN ud.email END ASC,
WHEN 'email_desc THEN ud.email END DESC,

nodes.bodyText:
looks like you are not handling anything but ASC, so you might as well remove sort direction from inputs and only pass the order by value here.
also your SQL is generating two ASC back to back

nodes.bodyText:
what if this value is already set?
It should come from the database and only be set in enroll/withdraw action where the status is being changed.
Removed else if condition as this method will be called when participant with Enrollment Status as enrolled.
keep the names consistent, is it a date, time or timestamp?
We copied these fields from ParticipantStudyEntity class for consistency. We may need to change code at many places if we rename the fields or columns.
This will be a breaking change after the public launch, please fix here for now and file an issue to fix in the ParticipantStudyEntity

     extends JpaRepository<ParticipantEnrollmentHistoryEntity, String> {
   @Query(
       value =
-          "SELECT DISTINCT peh.site_id AS siteId, peh.user_details_id AS userDetailsId, peh.study_info_id AS studyId, "
-              + "peh.status AS enrollmentStatus, peh.created_time AS created, loc.custom_id AS locationCustomId, loc.name AS locationName "
+          "SELECT peh.site_id AS siteId, peh.user_details_id AS userDetailsId, peh.study_info_id AS studyId, "
+              + "peh.status AS enrollmentStatus, peh.withdrawal_time AS withdrawalDate,  peh.enrolled_time AS enrolledDate, loc.custom_id AS locationCustomId, loc.name AS locationName "
               + "FROM participant_enrollment_history peh, locations loc, sites s "
               + "WHERE peh.site_id=s.id AND s.location_id=loc.id AND peh.status IN ('enrolled','withdrawn') AND "
               + "peh.user_details_id IN (:userIds) AND peh.app_info_id=:appId "
-              + "ORDER BY peh.user_details_id, peh.study_info_id, peh.site_id, peh.created_time DESC",
+              + "ORDER BY loc.name DESC",

nodes.bodyText: We've added enrollment & withdrawal date columns that simplified the logic to prepare the response object. We are displaying the sites (location name) so added ORDER BY for location name.

nodes.bodyText: if user is enrolled, then withdrawal date should be empty, no?

If enrollmentDate and withdrawalDate is empty we are setting it to default value as NOT_APPLICABLE. Changed expected value -
```
.andExpect(jsonPath("$.participantDetails.enrollmentDate", is(NOT_APPLICABLE)))
.andExpect(jsonPath("$.participantDetails.withdrawalDate", is(NOT_APPLICABLE)))
